title: Beacon backfilling failed. Retrieved hash chain is invalid: rename
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.13.5
CL client & version: prysm@v4.1.1
OS & Version: Windows
Commit hash : none

#### Actual behaviour


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I've got an error 
Beacon backfilling failed                err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: rename
A reload do nothing special. It's the second time for the month I've got the error. Just full resync helped me last time

#### Backtrace
```
WARN [12-18|08:48:15.518] Ignoring already known beacon payload    number=18,809,844 hash=2d79a6..621bb5 age=1h31m52s

ERROR[12-18|08:49:18.838] Beacon backfilling failed                err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: rename D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\1992345935 D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\storage.index.cidx: Access is denied."
```

After reload
```
WARN [12-18|08:53:44.432] Ignoring payload with missing parent     number=18,809,914 hash=dc34e7..068dd3 parent=c1f7a0..a930dd

. . . ignoring some blocks here

WARN [12-18|08:59:33.816] Served engine_forkchoiceUpdatedV2        conn=127.0.0.1:53633 reqid=45 duration=315.543ms  err="rename D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\2158743012 D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\storage.index.cidx: Access is denied."

ERROR[12-18|08:59:42.629] Please file an issue, skip known block execution without receipt hash=8116c7..1ab871 number=18,809,849
ERROR[12-18|08:59:42.922] Beacon backfilling failed                err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: rename D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\2475479740 D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\storage.index.cidx: Access is denied."
WARN [12-18|08:59:43.361] Marked new chain head as invalid         hash=5d4338..efa740 badnumber=18,809,850 badhash=57f42b..d9f90e
```

The error is `ERROR[12-18|08:59:42.922] Beacon backfilling failed                err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: rename D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\2475479740 D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\storage.index.cidx: Access is denied."
`

> The error is `ERROR[12-18|08:59:42.922] Beacon backfilling failed err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: rename D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\2475479740 D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\storage.index.cidx: Access is denied." `

I know. But how can i resolve it?
Do you have the permission to write the `D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata` folder?

> Do you have the permission to write the `D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata` folder?

I guess that I have. I didn't check it but my chaindata is located at **Geth2** folder. The folder **chaindata** as part of my entire data folder works fine all the time except that error. 
I don't know how I can check it after resyncing my chaindata

The error is reported when Geth fails to rename `D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\2475479740` to `D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\storage.index.cidx` because lacking of permission on Windows, not sure how much we can help here. Does it occur all the time or very rarely?

> The error is reported when Geth fails to rename `D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\2475479740` to `D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\storage.index.cidx` because lacking of permission on Windows, not sure how much we can help here. Does it occur all the time or very rarely?

Very rarely. Once a month. But there is no such file `D:\\Ethereum\\Data\\EL\\Geth2\\geth\\chaindata\\ancient\\state\\2475479740` in the folder.
It's a temp file. The strategy in geth is: we create a temp file first and do the rename at the end for atomic operation.

> It's a temp file. The strategy in geth is: we create a temp file first and do the rename at the end for atomic operation.
> 
> 

Got it. Will try to get right permissions. Thanks
